result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) .150. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) .150 was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin S. Kottwitz was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Off record - Per Judge O'Melia - Count 2 is dismissed per statutes

8:52 a.m. In Chambers. Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15cf52 and 15tr573. Jurors in courtroom. Schiek statement to resolution - Plea quesionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1 in 15cf52. State moves to find refusal reasonable in 15tr573 - Granted.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of OWI-7th. Sentencing date to be obtained from Branch 1 JA. No PSI is requested by either party. Defendant remanded into custody. Cash bond to be held until sentencing. Bail continued. Adj. 8:59 a.m. 
9:00 a.m. - In courtroom - Judge addresses jurors. Jurors released. Adj. 9:01 .m.
Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Off record. Present Judge O'Melia, District Attorney Michael Schiek, Defense Attorney Brian Bennett, witness J.S. via telephone. Call initiated by Court. Discussion concerning J.S. appearance at trial on June 13, 2016 and arrest warrant that has been issued. J.S. states he will be present for trial, has a ride arranged and will be in Rhinelander Sunday. JS assures Court that he will be here and there is no need for arrest warrant to be executed. Based on J.S. representations and assurances, Court quashes warrant. Bennett statement to JS regarding availability for voir dire by defense tomorrow morning via telephone. DA Schiek to call J.S. today.
Notified Brandi at ONSO - Judge O'Melia quashes warrant
cancelled by DA's office and reissued

8:35 a.m. - In chambers. Present - Defendant Kevin Kottwitz, with Attorney Brian Bennett, Michael William Schiek for State of Wisconsin,  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule and Three Lakes Officer Carl Bacon. Jurors not present - are in courtroom watching instructional video. Regarding Defense Motion to Withdraw filed June 1, 2016 - Court states parties advised off record yesterday that motion would not be immediately granted. Bennett/Schiek/Defendant's statements to motion and witness SK. State objects to testimony based on timeliness rules of discovery and alibi witness statute. Bennett objects to characterization of SK as alibi witness. Court finds alibi statute not applicable. Court will withhold ruling and will voire dire witness to determine how/when witness became available to testify. Defendant statement/Bennett statement/Schiek statement. Court rules - will leave voire dire of witness open; however there will be no mention of witness of SK during opening/closing statements; witness SK  may be called under oath to testify. Schiek/Bennett statements to timeliness of disclosure of witness. Court finds that disclosure is untimely per discovery rules - State had no time to investigate witness, especially considering the holiday weekend and witness SK cannot be offered by defendant.
Motions in Limine - Schiek/Bennett statements to motions
1 - Prior actions at Oneida Village Bar and testimony of bartender - allowed
2 - No objections 
3 - No objections
4 - All statements have been provided
5 - No objection 
6 - No objection
7 - No objection
8 - Miranda/Goodchild issues mostly resolved. State would like statements relating to field sobriety/refusal of blood tests admitted - no objection from Bennett. 
9 - No objection
10 - No objection - Officer Bacon not subject to sequestration
11 - No objection
12 - No objection
13 - Denied
14 - Denied
15 - Granted
16 - Priors to be decided if defendant testifies
17 - Granted
18 - Parties stipulate no reference to PBT test.
19 - Granted; except Court will allow .02 reference - finds that is not prejudicial
20 - Granted - testimony re T.S. to be allowed to ID defendant - jury to be informed of T.S. untimely death - Bennett has no objections
21 - Events at Oneida Village Bar allowed to determine reason for officer's involvement
22 - Granted

Court orders Defendant to pay all jury costs from today. Schiek statement to witness JS phone call to DA's office at 8:10 today - has proof of service of subpoena. Bennett has affidavit of J.S. filed 4/23/15 to submit in lieu of testimony - Discussion regarding whether statutory definition of availability of witness has been met. Court finds witness is unavailable; affidavit cannot be introduced as it is not former testimony and no opportunity to cross exam. Discussion held regarding today's proceeding, availability of witnesses and jury. Off record 9:33 a.m.
On record 9:34 a.m. - Witness JS now appears telephonically. Court questions witness. Court now calls mother, T.S., T.S. answers phone, when Court identifies purpose of call, call is disconnected. Court immediately calls phone number - busy signal. Court calls number again - immediately goes to voice mail. State needs witness JS to appear to testify, requests adjournment; Bennett has no objections. Court/Bennett/Schiek statement on bond. Discussion held regarding need for expert witnesses - analyst to be available by telephone; no need for lab technician testimony. Bail continued. Jury trial adjourned - parties to obtain new date for jury trial from JA. Recess 9:53 a.m.
On record 9:54 a.m. - In court, all juorors present. Court addresses jury. Jury discharged. Adj. 9:55 a.m.

2:40 p.m. Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett requests jury trial. Any pre-trial motions to be filed by Friday, May 13, 2016. Bail continued. Adj. 2:44  Jury trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

10:39 a.m.  Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Three Lakes Patrol Officer Bacon /sworn/direct by Schiek - witness ID's defendant / cross by Bennett/redirect by Schiek/Court questions witness. Schiek/Bennett/Court statement on motion - Court finds that any statements prior to handcuffs being placed on defendant are admissible; anything after handcuffs are placed - not admissible. Schiek requests final pre-trial date be scheduled. Bail continued. Adj. 11:02 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
to suppress statements

8:36 a.m. Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf52 and 15tr573. Bennett states still reviewing file, has received offer from June of last year; needs to determine if motions need to be filed. Bennett anticipates a motion for evidentiary suppression to be filed in next few weeks. Bail continued. Adj. 8:43 a.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
- includes cover letter
from JA re court appointed attorney

4:01 p.m. Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf52 and 15tr573. Court quashes warrant. Schiek states formal offer was submitted in June of 2015 that was rejected - Schiek states offer remains same. Defendant was aware of Bayne-Allison's withdrawal - Defendant contacted PD's office - advised today that he is not eligible for PD's office - Defendant wishes to obtain legal counsel to review offer from State - he has not reviewed offer. Defendant thought since he had not heard from attorney, State had dropped charges. Court questions defendant re financial status for court appointed attorney. Court finds defendant eligible for court-appointed attorney - explains that defendant will need to pay at rate of $50 per months - Court appoints Attorney Brian Bennett. Court cancels jury trial and schedules pre-trial conference for that time. Adj. 4:17 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:38 p.m Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz not in court.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf52 and 15tr573. Schiek statement that notice was sent to Attorney Bayne-Allison of today's hearing - Attorney Bayne-Allison has withdrawn as counsel - Attorney Bayne-Allison now in court - states withdrawal was not because of lack of contact - Bayne-Allison's routine procedure to provide clients of court dates and that warrant would be issued on mandatory court dates. Bayne-Allison advises Court of significant health problems and several hospitalizations. State requests warrant based on non-appearance. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:44 p.m.
Consent and Order for Withdrawal of Attorney-includes cover letter

3:15 Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bayne - Allison requests PTC. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 3:16 p.m.

03:06 pm - Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15tr573.  Has been working on obtaining past records - There may be a collateral attack - There are also factual issues with this case.  Adjournment requests.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned - 03:08 p.m.

03:11 pm - Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bayne-Allison in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Also calling 15tr573.  Bayne-Allison requests a status conference date - defendant need not appear.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:11 pm - Defendant Kevin S. Kottwitz in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15tr573.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
